intro: Chaetolepis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved chaetolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and shrublands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stems, and it produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. This species is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
